item.title: Newsletter for September 2022
item.guid: Newsletter for September 2022
item.description: Hi everyone, We are now in September and we release our 6th Newsletter! Ranging from podcasts to tutorials, this Newsletter is made for practicioners!

item.title: Deep RL and Optimization applied to Operations Research problem - 2/2 Reinforcement Learning approach
item.guid: Deep RL and Optimization applied to Operations Research problem - 2/2 Reinforcement Learning approach
item.description: This article is part of a series of articles which will introduce several optimization techniques, from traditional (yet advanced) Mathematical Optimization solvers and associated packages to Deep Reinforcement Learning algorithms, while tackling a very famous Operations Research problem: the multi-knapsack problem. Here, the focus is on an approach based on two famous reinforcement learning algorithms: Q-Learning and Policy Gradient.

item.title: Deep RL and Optimization applied to Operations Research problem - 1/2 Traditional Optimization techniques
item.guid: Deep RL and Optimization applied to Operations Research problem - 1/2 Traditional Optimization techniques
item.description: This article is part of a series of articles which will introduce several optimization techniques, from traditional (yet advanced) Mathematical Optimization solvers and associated packages to Deep Reinforcement Learning algorithms, while tackling a very famous Operations Research problem: the multi-knapsack problem. Here, the focus is on traditional optimization techniques.

item.title: Exploring neural ordinary differential equations for time series forecasting applications
item.guid: Exploring neural ordinary differential equations for time series forecasting applications
item.description: Enhance your knowledge on Deep Learning techniques by understanding what neural ODEs are and how we could benefit from them.

item.title: Newsletter for June 2022
item.guid: Newsletter for June 2022
item.description: We are now at the start of July and we release our 5th Newsletter! Ranging from podcasts to tutorials, this Newsletter is made for practicioners!

item.title: Bayesian inference for better predictions of magazine sales
item.guid: Bayesian inference for better predictions of magazine sales
item.description: This article describes how Ekimetrics helped major press publishers using Bayesian inference for sales prediction.

item.title: Newsletter for April 2022
item.guid: Newsletter for April 2022
item.description: We are now at the start of May and we release our 4th Newsletter! Ranging from podcasts to tutorials, this Newsletter is made for practicioners!

item.title: Deploying your Data Science app to the Cloud
item.guid: Deploying your Data Science app to the Cloud
item.description: Let's explore how we, at Ekimetrics, automate the deployment of our data apps on the cloud. This article will gather elements from our internal & external workshops presented at Datacraft and also the video presenting some docker best practices for industrialization.

item.title: Newsletter for March 2022
item.guid: Newsletter for March 2022
item.description: Ekimetrics is pleased to release its third Newsletter for the year 2022! A new feature has now been added which is a special section detailing some news that we would like to share but are not specifically linked to one of our main categories. As usual, do not hesitate to check the links added and of course using it live during your projects!

item.title: Power BI - Improve your development process by using multiple environments
item.guid: Power BI - Improve your development process by using multiple environments
item.description: Learn in this article why and how to use different environments when developing products in Power BI.

item.title: Newsletter for February 2022
item.guid: Newsletter for February 2022
item.description: Ekimetrics is pleased to release its second Newsletter of 2022! This cheat sheet will brief you quickly about the latest news in the fields of Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Engineering and Application Development. Warning this one is particularly ruled by DeepMind so be prepared!

item.title: Demand Forecasting - Improving Supply Chain operations in uncertain times
item.guid: Demand Forecasting - Improving Supply Chain operations in uncertain times
item.description: Learn in this article how we industrialized a solution for warehouse demand forecasting to help Operations managers better allocate resources for more than 20.000 referenced products

item.title: Ekimetrics implements Data Mesh. Here is why, and why you should join us
item.guid: Ekimetrics implements Data Mesh. Here is why, and why you should join us
item.description: This article describes one of the inspirational patterns that drive our projectsâ€™ data architectures, the Data Mesh.

item.title: Building a datalake - Part 1 - Usable, Useful, Used, or how to avoid dataswamp and empty shell traps
item.guid: Building a datalake - Part 1 - Usable, Useful, Used, or how to avoid dataswamp and empty shell traps
item.description: In this article, learn how to create your first datalake following best practices in order to make it robust, evolutive and central to your company's information architecture, as well as take advantage of the opportunities it presents.

item.title: Which AutoML platform to choose to start your Data Science project?
item.guid: Which AutoML platform to choose to start your Data Science project?
item.description: How do Automatic Machine Learning solutions work? What are the most popular AutoML solutions out there, and what do you need to know about them to make the right choice for your use case? Find answers to these questions and many others in this article.

item.title: Hackathon Stories - Ensuring access to affordable and clean energy
item.guid: Hackathon Stories - Ensuring access to affordable and clean energy
item.description: Read this article to see how and why Ekimetrics organize hackathons to foster creativity, innovation and team work in our Data teams. Also learn important tips for organizing your own hackathons.

item.title: Customer Journey Clustering - How to use sequential modeling techniques to handle customer journey data
item.guid: Customer Journey Clustering - How to use sequential modeling techniques to handle customer journey data
item.description: Enrich your understanding of customer journeys through clustering using image embedding, autoencoders and unsupervised learning.

item.title: Introduction to Pyepidemics - epidemiological modeling in Python
item.guid: introduction-pyepidemics
item.description: We created Pyepidemics, an open-source library to simulate epidemics (SIR, SEIHDR, COVID19). We detail in this article what you can build with the library.

item.title: Solving the Traveling Salesman Problem with Reinforcement Learning
item.guid: Solving the Traveling Salesman Problem with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: A practical use of Reinforcement Learning and the Q-Learning algorithm to solve the Traveling Salesman Problem

item.title: Deploying a Python Dash application for beginners
item.guid: dash-deployment
item.description: Learn the basics of application deployment from simple examples on Heroku to creating Docker containers

item.title: Welcome to the new Ekimetrics Tech website!
item.guid: welcome
item.description: Welcome to EkiLab website - the Ekimetrics technology & innovation blog and website!
